comments:
Build ID: Build id: I20070503-1400

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open any existing project that is using EMF annotated Java.
2. Add a java 5 enum to the project (do not specify any EMF annotations in this enum file.
3. Attempt to re-load your .genmodel from annotated java.


More information:
This problem exists in 2.3 RC1 and prior.

From newsgroup post.

Ed Merks responded:

Dave,

I had a look and it looks like a bug introduced when the handling of Java 5.0 enums was added.  The code assumes that the @model annotation isn't null when it should be checking for that.  Please open a bugzilla so that we can fix it.  (I suppose the only workaround is to add an @model.)


Dave wrote:

I upgraded to RC1 and the first issue was resolved.  I do have an outstanding issue with re-loading a .genmodel file from annotated java though that exists in the RC1 release.  I noticed that that EMF doesn't like it when there is a Java 5 enum class anywhere in a project.  Having a java 5 enum anywhere in the project seems to cause the re-load command from annotated java to error out.  There are no model tags etc. anywhere in the enum file itself.  Any thoughts?
Thanks Here is the stack trace:
